description.db:para:
This table is used by the carrierroute module to provide failure routing capabilities. It contains the failureroute routing informations. More information is available at:
&KAMAILIO_MOD_DOC;carrierroute.html.

column.name: id
column.description: This column contains the unique identifier of a failure route.

column.name: carrier
column.description: This column contains the carrier id.

column.name: domain
column.description: This column contains the routing domain id. You can define several routing domains to have different routing rules. Maybe you use domain 0 for normal routing and domain 1 if domain 0 failed.

column.name: scan_prefix
column.description: Name of column contains the the scan prefixes. Scan prexies define the matching portion of a phone number, e.g. we have the scan prefixes 49721 and 49, the called number is 49721913740, it matches 49721, because the longest match is taken. If no prefix matches, the number is not failure routed. To prevent this, an empty prefix value of could be added.

column.name: host_name
column.description: Name of the column containing the host name of the last routing destination, using for rules matching.

column.name: reply_code
column.description: This column contains the reply code used for rule matching.

column.name: flags
column.description: This column contains the flags used for rule matching.

column.name: mask
column.description: This column contains the mask that is applied to the message flags before rule matching.

column.name: next_domain
column.description: This column contains the route domain id that should be used for the next routing attempt.

column.name: description
column.description: A comment for the route entry, useful for larger routing tables.
